Name: Canopic jar with lid in the shape of a falcon's head
Description: This set of canopic jars is very large and heavy. The shape of the jars is not quite uniform, but all have been hollowed out very deeply. The lids feature the usual heads of an ape, a jackal, a human being, and in this case the head of a falcon. There are no inscriptions. Canopic jars of this size do not usually belong to private individuals.
